availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Resident of Woodford County in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Married Elizabeth T. Norwood on January 20, 1863. Signed a petition on behalf of D. B. Price in Midway, Kentucky, on October 5, 1863. Served as a Provost Marshal and recruiting officer in Midway during the war.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 1. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 1, p. 645. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, p. 102. Marriage Records. Kentucky Marriages (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), Film 000252336. KYR-0001-004-0182. KYR-0001-004-0182.
